message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I'm a primary or secondary school teacher from Azerbaijan. I need to provide responses to 10 statements about AI in education.

Let me think about how a thoughtful teacher from Azerbaijan might respond to these statements, considering both the benefits and risks of AI in education:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally a positive application. I would say "Agree" - it's true that AI can help with this.

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is another positive use case. I would say "Agree" - personalization is a known benefit of AI.

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - This is also a positive application. I would say "Agree".

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs - This is a positive and important benefit. I would say "Agree".

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is clearly a positive benefit. I would say "Strongly agree" - this is one of the clearest benefits.

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a concerning risk. I would say "Agree" - this is a real concern with AI tools.

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is a valid concern. I would say "Agree" - AI systems can make errors.

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a concerning risk. I would say "Agree" - this is a documented problem with AI systems.

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a significant concern. I would say "Agree" - data privacy is a real concern.

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This could happen. I would say "Agree" - AI might not understand proper pedagogical principles fully.


I should provide responses that reflect both the genuine advantages AI offers in supporting teaching and learning, as well as the legitimate concerns educators need to consider when implementing these tools in classrooms.
